cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 200 miles SSE of Lake Charles, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northwest toward the upper Texas and southwest Louisiana coast, then turning north across Louisiana and Arkansas before curving northeast through the mid-Mississippi Valley and Appalachians and moving off the Mid-Atlantic coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: upper Texas / southwest Louisiana coast near the TX-LA border

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm Surge Watch: Mouth of the Mississippi River to Ocean Springs MS, including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas, and Lake Borgne; Hurricane Watch: east of Intracoastal City to west of Morgan City LA
weather_observation.warning_coast: Storm Surge Warning: Freeport TX to the Mouth of the Mississippi River; Hurricane Warning: San Luis Pass TX to Intracoastal City LA; Tropical Storm Warning: Sargent TX to San Luis Pass TX and east of Intracoastal City LA to the Mouth of the Mississippi River
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Greatest impacts expected along the northwest Gulf Coast from Sea Rim State Park TX to Intracoastal City LA, then inland across Louisiana and Arkansas
weather_observation.wind: No significant tropical-storm-force winds expected; occasional gusty breezes possible as remnants pass south and east of the port
weather_observation.rainfall: Remnant moisture could bring 1–2 inches of rain to northwest Ohio late Saturday into Sunday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Minimal—isolated thunderstorms; tornado risk remains well south of the port
